s.text: "An admirable, courageous and meticulously fair and honest book," says Roger Parloff in the New York Times Book Review . Kennedy's endorsement of extreme race-neutrality--race shouldn't be a factor in stopping criminal-suspect searches or in assembling juries, he says--does strike a few as naive.

"[W]e have a book worthy of its subject--graceful, astonishingly well researched, yet imbued with a sense of flow that is rarely achieved at this level of scholarship," says Daphne Merkin in the New York Times Book Review . (See Sarah Kerr's review in Slate.)
Reading the book, she says, "is like being on confidential terms with someone who hates her boss.
The New Republic 's James Wood admires its "own nervous perfection," and Alfred Kazin, writing in the New York Review of Books , rates it a notch below Bellow's great works.
The New Republic 's James Wood admires its "own nervous perfection," and Alfred Kazin, writing in the New York Review of Books , rates it a notch below Bellow's great works.
The New Republic 's James Wood admires its "own nervous perfection," and Alfred Kazin, writing in the New York Review of Books , rates it a notch below Bellow's great works.
The New Republic 's James Wood admires its "own nervous perfection," and Alfred Kazin, writing in the New York Review of Books , rates it a notch below Bellow's great works.

"[W]e have a book worthy of its subject--graceful, astonishingly well researched, yet imbued with a sense of flow that is rarely achieved at this level of scholarship," says Daphne Merkin in the New York Times Book Review . (See Sarah Kerr's review in Slate.)
The megastar of '80s pop has hit bottom, critics say.
Glimpses into his character "do not add up to a full motivation for Bunt's aimlessness" (Thomas Keneally, the New York Times Book Review ).

"An admirable, courageous and meticulously fair and honest book," says Roger Parloff in the New York Times Book Review . Kennedy's endorsement of extreme race-neutrality--race shouldn't be a factor in stopping criminal-suspect searches or in assembling juries, he says--does strike a few as naive.

"An admirable, courageous and meticulously fair and honest book," says Roger Parloff in the New York Times Book Review . Kennedy's endorsement of extreme race-neutrality--race shouldn't be a factor in stopping criminal-suspect searches or in assembling juries, he says--does strike a few as naive.
Book -- Reading in the Dark , by Seamus Deane;
